Package craterdog.security

Class RsaCertificateManager

java.lang.Object
craterdog.security.CertificateManager
craterdog.security.RsaCertificateManager
public final class RsaCertificateManager extends CertificateManager
This class provides an RSA specific implementation of the CertificateManager abstract class.
Author:
Derk Norton

  • Method Details

    • createCertificateAuthority

      public X509Certificate createCertificateAuthority(PrivateKey privateKey, PublicKey publicKey, String subjectString, BigInteger serialNumber, long lifetime)
      Description copied from class: CertificateManager
      This method creates a new self-signed X509 certificate for a new certificate authority (CA).
      Specified by:
      createCertificateAuthority in class CertificateManager
      Parameters:
      privateKey - The private key for the new certificate.
      publicKey - The public key that the new certificate is encoding.
      subjectString - The distinguished name for the certificate (e.g. CN=Derk Norton, O=Crater Dog Technologies).
      serialNumber - The unique serial number for the new certificate.
      lifetime - The number of milliseconds before the certificate should expire.
      Returns:
      The new signed certificate.

    • createSigningRequest

      public org.bouncycastle.pkcs.PKCS10CertificationRequest createSigningRequest(PrivateKey privateKey, PublicKey publicKey, String subjectString)
      This method creates a new certificate signing request (CSR) using the specified key pair and subject string. This is a convenience method that really should be part of the CertificateManagement interface except that it depends on a Bouncy Castle class in the signature. The java security framework does not have a similar class so it has been left out of the interface.
      Parameters:
      privateKey - The private key to be used to sign the request.
      publicKey - The corresponding public key that is to be wrapped in the new certificate.
      subjectString - The subject string to be included in the generated certificate.
      Returns:
      The newly created CSR.

    • signCertificateRequest

      public X509Certificate signCertificateRequest(PrivateKey caPrivateKey, X509Certificate caCertificate, org.bouncycastle.pkcs.PKCS10CertificationRequest request, BigInteger serialNumber, long lifetime)
      This method signs a certificate signing request (CSR) using the specified certificate authority (CA). This is a convenience method that really should be part of the CertificateManagement interface except that it depends on a Bouncy Castle class in the signature. The java security framework does not have a similar class so it has been left out of the interface.
      Parameters:
      caPrivateKey - The private key for the certificate authority.
      caCertificate - The certificate containing the public key for the certificate authority.
      request - The certificate signing request (CSR) to be signed.
      serialNumber - The serial number for the new certificate.
      lifetime - How long the certificate should be valid.
      Returns:
      The newly signed certificate.

    • createCertificate

      public X509Certificate createCertificate(PrivateKey caPrivateKey, X509Certificate caCertificate, PublicKey publicKey, String subjectString, BigInteger serialNumber, long lifetime)
      Description copied from class: CertificateManager
      This method creates a new X509 certificate that is signed by a certificate authority (CA).
      Specified by:
      createCertificate in class CertificateManager
      Parameters:
      caPrivateKey - The private key for the certificate authority.
      caCertificate - The public certificate for the certificate authority.
      publicKey - The public key that the new certificate is encoding.
      subjectString - The distinguished name for the certificate (e.g. CN=Derk Norton, O=Crater Dog Technologies).
      serialNumber - The unique serial number for the new certificate.
      lifetime - The number of milliseconds before the certificate should expire.
      Returns:
      The new signed certificate.

    • encodeSigningRequest

      public String encodeSigningRequest(org.bouncycastle.pkcs.PKCS10CertificationRequest csr)
      This method encodes a certificate signing request (CSR) into a string for transport purposes. This is a convenience method that really should be part of the CertificateManagement interface except that it depends on a Bouncy Castle class in the signature. The java security framework does not have a similar class so it has been left out of the interface.
      Parameters:
      csr - The certificate signing request.
      Returns:
      The encoded certificate signing request string.

    • decodeSigningRequest

      public org.bouncycastle.pkcs.PKCS10CertificationRequest decodeSigningRequest(String csr)
      This method decodes a certificate signing request (CSR) from a string. This is a convenience method that really should be part of the CertificateManagement interface except that it depends on a Bouncy Castle class in the signature. The java security framework does not have a similar class so it has been left out of the interface.
      Parameters:
      csr - The encoded certificate signing request.
      Returns:
      The decoded certificate signing request.

      Description copied from class: CertificateManager

      Specified by:
      encodeCertificate in class CertificateManager
      Parameters:
      certificate - The X509 format certificate.
      Returns:
      The corresponding PEM string.
